result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanisha M Triplett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tanisha M Triplett appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Tanisha M Triplett.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel requests an additional status date as she may be filing a motion.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Tanisha M Triplett appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Tanisha M Triplett.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tanisha M Triplett
Current: 8820 W Capitol DR, Milwaukee, WI 53225 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 1667 South 32nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tanisha M Triplett in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/23/22 @ 1:30p
